io.github.rubenchristoffer.hetty

Class HTTPPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.rubenchristoffer.hetty.HTTPPacket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DeepCloneable<HTTPPacket>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HTTPRequest, HTTPResponse

    public abstract class HTTPPacket
extends Object
implements DeepCloneable<HTTPPacket>
    Class representing a HTTP packet / message. This can be cast to either a HTTPRequest or a HTTPResponse object.
    Author:
    Ruben Christoffer

    • Method Detail

      • setHeaders

        public void setHeaders(String multipleHeaders,
                       String delimiter)
        Sets all the headers by one string. Headers are separated by delimiter. All cases of '\r' is removed from headers.
        Parameters:
        multipleHeaders - is a string containing multiple full headers seperated by delimiter
        delimiter - is the string that determines how headers should be split. This is usually '\n'
        See Also:
        addHeader(String)

      • addHeader

        public void addHeader(String fullHeader)
        Adds a header that is properly formatted.
        Parameters:
        fullHeader - is a string that is properly formatted and ready to add to packet without further processing

      • addHeader

        public void addHeader(String name,
                      String content)
        Adds a header using name of header and its content.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the header
        content - is the content / value of the header

      • insertHeader

        public void insertHeader(String name,
                         String content,
                         int index)
        Inserts a header at the given index.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the header
        content - is the content / value of the header
        index - is the index where you want to insert header

      • getHeaders

        public List<String> getHeaders()
        Gets headers.
        Returns:
        read-only wrapper list that is always up-to-date

      • changeHeader

        public void changeHeader(String name,
                         String content)
        Changes the first header content with the given name and content
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the header
        content - is the new content / value of the header

      • changeHeader

        public void changeHeader(String name,
                         int index,
                         String content)
        Changes the header content with the given name, content and index
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the header
        index - is the index of header in comparison to other headers with same name (if any)
        content - is the new content / value of the header

      • changeOrAddHeader

        public void changeOrAddHeader(String name,
                              String content)
        Changes or adds a new header given whether or not the header exists or not.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the header
        content - is the content / value of the header
        See Also:
        changeHeader(String, String), addHeader(String, String)

      • changeOrInsertHeader

        public void changeOrInsertHeader(String name,
                                 String content,
                                 int index)
        Changes or inserts a new header given whether or not the header exists or not.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the header
        content - is the content / value of the header
        index - is the index where you want to insert header (if header does not already exist)
        See Also:
        changeHeader(String, String), insertHeader(String, String, int)

      • getHeaders

        public List<String> getHeaders(String name)
        Gets headers by name.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of header(s)
        Returns:
        read-only list wrapper that is always up-to-date

      • getHeader

        public String getHeader(String name,
                        String content)
        Gets header content with the given name and content.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the header
        content - is the content / value of the header
        Returns:
        header if found, null otherwise

      • doesHeaderExist

        public boolean doesHeaderExist(String name)
        Returns true if any header with the provided name exists.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of header
        Returns:
        true if header exists, false otherwise
        See Also:
        getHeaders(String)

      • doesHeaderExist

        public boolean doesHeaderExist(String name,
                               String content)
        Returns true if the header with provided name exists and has the provided content
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the header
        content - is the content / value of the header
        Returns:
        true if header exists, false otherwise
        See Also:
        getHeader(String, String)

      • removeHeader

        public void removeHeader(String name)
        Removes the first header found by name.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the header

      • removeHeader

        public void removeHeader(String name,
                         int index)
        Removes the header by name and index is used for telling which header should be removed if there are multiple
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the header
        index - is the index in comparison to other headers with same name

      • removeHeaderIfExists

        public void removeHeaderIfExists(String name)
        Removes header by name if it exists.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the header
        See Also:
        doesHeaderExist(String), removeHeader(String)

      • setBody

        public void setBody(byte[] body)
        Sets the body of the HTTP packet. Use null or empty array for empty body.
        Parameters:
        body - is the byte array representing body of HTTP packet

      • getBody

        public byte[] getBody()
        Gets the body of the HTTP packet. Note that this makes a copy of the internal body stream.
        Returns:
        the body expressed as byte array

      • getBodyLength

        public int getBodyLength()
        Gets body length (byte count).
        Returns:
        the length of internal byte stream

      • getBodyStream

        public ByteArrayOutputStream getBodyStream()
        Gets the internal body stream. Writing to this stream WILL update internal body stream.
        Returns:
        ByteArrayOutputStream that you can write to

      • setVersion

        public void setVersion(String version)
        Sets the version of the HTTP packet.
        Parameters:
        version - is the new version value you want to set

      • getVersion

        public String getVersion()
        Gets the version of the HTTP packet.
        Returns:
        version value set for this packet

      • addFilter

        public void addFilter(HTTPPacketFilter filter)
        Adds a new filter to the pipeline. This will add it to the end of the pipeline.
        Parameters:
        filter - is the packet filter you want to add
        Throws:
        HTTPPacketException - if a filter by that name already exists

      • insertFilter

        public void insertFilter(HTTPPacketFilter filter,
                         int index)
        Inserts a new filter into the pipeline at a given index.
        Parameters:
        filter - is the packet filter you want to add
        index - is the index where you want to insert filter
        Throws:
        HTTPPacketException - if a filter by that name already exists

      • getFilter

        public HTTPPacketFilter getFilter(String name)
        Gets filter by name.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the filter
        Returns:
        HTTPPacketFilter if filter exists, null otherwise

      • getFilters

        public List<HTTPPacketFilter> getFilters()
        Gets filters in pipeline.
        Returns:
        read-only list wrapper that is always up-to-date

      • removeFilter

        public void removeFilter(String name)
        Removes a filter by name.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the filter you want to remove

      • appendBytes

        protected static void appendBytes(ByteArrayOutputStream builder,
                                  byte[] bytes)

      • appendHeaderText

        protected static void appendHeaderText(ByteArrayOutputStream builder,
                                       String headerText)

      • appendHeaders

        protected static void appendHeaders(ByteArrayOutputStream builder,
                                    HTTPPacket packet)

      • generatePacket

        public HTTPRawPacket generatePacket(URL url)
        Same as generatePacket(URL, boolean) where applyFilters=true
        Parameters:
        url - is the URL you want to generate packet for
        Returns:
        HTTPRawPacket object

      • generatePacket

        public abstract HTTPRawPacket generatePacket(URL url,
                                             boolean applyFilters)
        Generates a raw HTTP packet given a URL. No URL is needed for generating HTTP response packets. If you set applyFilters to true, it will pass packet through all HTTP Filters in the pipeline before generating packet.
        Parameters:
        url - is the URL you want to generate packet for
        applyFilters - determines whether filters will be applied before generating packet
        Returns:
        HTTPRawPacket object

      • applyFilters

        public void applyFilters(URL url)
        Permanently applies all filters in pipeline. No URL is needed for filtering HTTP response packets.
        Parameters:
        url - is the URL you want to apply filters for

      • filterAll

        public static HTTPPacket filterAll(HTTPPacket packet,
                                   URL url)
        Creates a cloned instance of packet and applies all filters to it
        Parameters:
        packet - is the packet you want to filter
        url - is the URL you want to apply filters for
        Returns:
        HTTPPacket clone that has all filteres applied

      • getCookies

        public abstract HTTPCookie[] getCookies()
        Gets cookies.
        Returns:
        Array of all cookies found in packet

      • isResponse

        public abstract boolean isResponse()
        Is this packet a response or request?
        Returns:
        true if instance of HTTPResponse, false if instance of HTTPRequest
